thread.title: Without Reserve: AMP makes the call to sell Ghostbusters building in Boston
thread.title_full: Without Reserve: AMP makes the call to sell Ghostbusters building in Boston

title: Without Reserve: AMP makes the call to sell Ghostbusters building in Boston
text:
An AMP Capital fund has sold Liberty Square in Boston. Photo: Supplied
AMP Capital's Global Direct Property Fund has sold Liberty Square, a core office building in the Boston CBD, for $US28.25 million ($40.26m). The sum was well above the December 2012 purchase price of $US17.6 million. The property, which has been used for the filming of the new Ghostbusters movie, is an 11-storey B Grade office building. AMP Capital Global Direct fund manager Tim Falletâ€‹ said the deal came at a time of renewed demand for core office investments in the US and the cash raised would be recycled into other top-tier secondary US markets identified as being poised for growth.
Surf's up for Life Property Group
A private developer, Life Property Group, is investing $5.5 million in the integrated Belrose Austlink Business Park in Sydney's northern beaches precinct. Within the precinct is the Kookaburra Business Park, where Life Property is developing 25 industrial units. Life Property director Bill Ryder said 40 per cent of the units, which have been designed by MSK Architects, had been sold as they were the first new small industrial units to be built in the area in nearly 10 years.
